20110130170007.000|20110130175948.000|SEG|Type=Story
20110130170007.000|20110130170009.000|TR0|CANDY CROWLEY, HOST:  There is chaos and 
20110130170009.000|20110130170012.000|TR0|confusion in Egypt. State-run television 
20110130170012.000|20110130170015.000|TR0|is reporting at least 38 are dead 
20110130170015.000|20110130170018.000|TR0|following massive protests demanding the 
20110130170018.000|20110130170020.000|TR0|end of the 30-year rule of President Hosni 
20110130170020.000|20110130170023.000|TR0|Mubarak.
20110130170023.000|20110130170026.000|TR0|
20110130170026.000|20110130170029.000|TR0|Witnesses describe a scene that suggests 
20110130170029.000|20110130170031.000|TR0|anarchy.  One man said people are parading 
20110130170031.000|20110130170034.000|TR0|the streets, walking around with baseball 
20110130170034.000|20110130170037.000|TR0|bats and knifes.  It's a situation that 
20110130170037.000|20110130170040.000|TR0|has enormous implications not just in 
20110130170040.000|20110130170042.000|TR0|Egypt, but in the entire Middle East and 
20110130170042.000|20110130170045.000|TR0|the U.S.
20110130170045.000|20110130170048.000|TR0|
20110130170048.000|20110130170051.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)
20110130170051.000|20110130170054.000|TR0|

20110130170056.000|20110130170059.000|TR0|the crisis in Cairo with Secretary of 
20110130170059.000|20110130170102.000|TR0|State Hillary Clinton.
20110130170102.000|20110130170105.000|TR0|
20110130170105.000|20110130170107.000|TR0|CLINTON:  We support the universal human 
20110130170107.000|20110130170110.000|TR0|rights of the Egyptian people, including 
20110130170110.000|20110130170113.000|TR0|the right to freedom of expression, of 
20110130170113.000|20110130170116.000|TR0|association, and of assembly.

20110130170121.000|20110130170124.000|TR0|Deputy Secretary of State John Negroponte, 
20110130170124.000|20110130170127.000|TR0|and former Ambassador to Egypt Edward 
20110130170127.000|20110130170130.000|TR0|Walker, and senior senators Republican 
20110130170130.000|20110130170132.000|TR0|John McCain and Democrat Chuck Schumer.

20110130170138.000|20110130170141.000|TR0|the Union."

20110130170152.000|20110130170154.000|TR0|Obama administration in a delicate 
20110130170154.000|20110130170157.000|TR0|position.  Joining me from the State 
20110130170157.000|20110130170200.000|TR0|Department, Secretary of State Hillary 
20110130170200.000|20110130170203.000|TR0|Clinton.
20110130170203.000|20110130170205.000|TR0|

20110130170208.000|20110130170211.000|TR0|
20110130170211.000|20110130170214.000|TR0|CLINTON:  Thank you, Candy.
20110130170214.000|20110130170217.000|TR0|
20110130170217.000|20110130170219.000|TR0|CROWLEY:  It seems to me that when this 
20110130170219.000|20110130170222.000|TR0|started out and we saw the signs and the 
20110130170222.000|20110130170225.000|TR0|protesters in the street, they were 
20110130170225.000|20110130170228.000|TR0|anti-Mubarak. Now, if you are watching, we 
20110130170228.000|20110130170230.000|TR0|are seeing signs that say "U.S., stop 
20110130170230.000|20110130170233.000|TR0|backing Mubarak."  What side is the U.S. 
20110130170233.000|20110130170236.000|TR0|on, Mubarak or the people in the streets?
20110130170236.000|20110130170239.000|TR0|
20110130170239.000|20110130170241.000|TR0|CLINTON:  Well, there's another choice.  
20110130170241.000|20110130170244.000|TR0|It's the Egyptian people.  We are on the 
20110130170244.000|20110130170247.000|TR0|side -- as we have been for more than 30 
20110130170247.000|20110130170250.000|TR0|years -- of a democratic Egypt that 
20110130170250.000|20110130170253.000|TR0|provides both political and economic 
20110130170253.000|20110130170255.000|TR0|rights to its people, that respects the 
20110130170255.000|20110130170258.000|TR0|universal human rights of all Egyptians.  
20110130170258.000|20110130170301.000|TR0|And that is the message that every 
20110130170301.000|20110130170304.000|TR0|ambassador, whether Republican or 
20110130170304.000|20110130170306.000|TR0|Democratic president, everyone has 
20110130170306.000|20110130170309.000|TR0|conveyed for over 30 years.
20110130170309.000|20110130170312.000|TR0|
20110130170312.000|20110130170315.000|TR0|What happens is truly up to the Egyptian 
20110130170315.000|20110130170317.000|TR0|people.  And what the United States is 
20110130170317.000|20110130170320.000|TR0|doing is sending a very clear message:  We 
20110130170320.000|20110130170323.000|TR0|wish to see everyone refrain from 
20110130170323.000|20110130170326.000|TR0|violence.  The army is now fulfilling 
20110130170326.000|20110130170329.000|TR0|security responsibilities.  They're a 
20110130170329.000|20110130170331.000|TR0|respected institution in Egyptian society. 
20110130170331.000|20110130170334.000|TR0| And we know they have a delicate line to 
20110130170334.000|20110130170337.000|TR0|walk, because they want to protect 
20110130170337.000|20110130170340.000|TR0|peaceful protests, but they also don't 
20110130170340.000|20110130170342.000|TR0|want to see any city descend into chaos 
20110130170342.000|20110130170345.000|TR0|with looting and criminal activity.  And 
20110130170345.000|20110130170348.000|TR0|we are encouraging a very -- a very 
20110130170348.000|20110130170351.000|TR0|careful approach that respects the rights 
20110130170351.000|20110130170353.000|TR0|of people.
20110130170353.000|20110130170356.000|TR0|
20110130170356.000|20110130170359.000|TR0|We are also very much behind the kind of 
20110130170359.000|20110130170402.000|TR0|concrete steps that need to be taken for 
20110130170402.000|20110130170404.000|TR0|economic and political reform.  We have, 
20110130170404.000|20110130170407.000|TR0|over the past 30 years, supported civil 
20110130170407.000|20110130170410.000|TR0|society groups.  We have supported women's 
20110130170410.000|20110130170413.000|TR0|groups.  We have tried to help build up a 
20110130170413.000|20110130170416.000|TR0|lot of the elements within Egyptian 
20110130170416.000|20110130170418.000|TR0|society that are going to be necessary 
20110130170418.000|20110130170421.000|TR0|when there is a national dialogue as we 
20110130170421.000|20110130170424.000|TR0|are urging to determine the path forward.
20110130170424.000|20110130170427.000|TR0|
20110130170427.000|20110130170429.000|TR0|And clearly, Candy, this is a complex, 
20110130170429.000|20110130170432.000|TR0|very difficult situation. Egypt has been a 
20110130170432.000|20110130170435.000|TR0|partner of the United States over the last 
20110130170435.000|20110130170438.000|TR0|30 years, has been instrumental in keeping 
20110130170438.000|20110130170440.000|TR0|the peace in the Middle East between Egypt 
20110130170440.000|20110130170443.000|TR0|and Israel, which is a critical 
20110130170443.000|20110130170446.000|TR0|accomplishment that has meant so much to 
20110130170446.000|20110130170449.000|TR0|so many people.
20110130170449.000|20110130170452.000|TR0|
20110130170452.000|20110130170454.000|TR0|So I think we have to keep on the message 
20110130170454.000|20110130170457.000|TR0|we've been on, convey that publicly and 
20110130170457.000|20110130170500.000|TR0|privately as we are doing, and stand ready 
20110130170500.000|20110130170503.000|TR0|to help with the kind of transition that 
20110130170503.000|20110130170505.000|TR0|will lead to greater political and 
20110130170505.000|20110130170508.000|TR0|economic freedom.
20110130170508.000|20110130170511.000|TR0|
20110130170511.000|20110130170514.000|TR0|CROWLEY:  The president's remarks, in 
20110130170514.000|20110130170516.000|TR0|which he said much of what you just said, 
20110130170516.000|20110130170519.000|TR0|warning against huge crackdowns against 
20110130170519.000|20110130170522.000|TR0|peaceful protesters, saying we've got to 
20110130170522.000|20110130170525.000|TR0|see some concrete steps towards opening up 
20110130170525.000|20110130170528.000|TR0|political reform and advancing it, it's 
20110130170528.000|20110130170530.000|TR0|been interpreted here by many and some 
20110130170530.000|20110130170533.000|TR0|overseas as a beginning to back away from 
20110130170533.000|20110130170536.000|TR0|President Mubarak.  Do you argue with that 
20110130170536.000|20110130170539.000|TR0|translation?
20110130170539.000|20110130170541.000|TR0|
20110130170541.000|20110130170544.000|TR0|CLINTON:  We -- we do not want to send any 
20110130170544.000|20110130170547.000|TR0|message about backing forward or backing 
20110130170547.000|20110130170550.000|TR0|back.  What we're trying to do is to help 
20110130170550.000|20110130170552.000|TR0|clear the air so that those who remain in 
20110130170552.000|20110130170555.000|TR0|power, starting with President Mubarak, 
20110130170555.000|20110130170558.000|TR0|with his new vice president, with the new 
20110130170558.000|20110130170601.000|TR0|prime minister, will begin a process of 
20110130170601.000|20110130170603.000|TR0|reaching out, of creating a dialogue that 
20110130170603.000|20110130170606.000|TR0|will bring in peaceful activists and 
20110130170606.000|20110130170609.000|TR0|representatives of civil society to, you 
20110130170609.000|20110130170612.000|TR0|know, plan a way forward that will meet 
20110130170612.000|20110130170615.000|TR0|the legitimate grievances of the Egyptian 
20110130170615.000|20110130170617.000|TR0|people.
20110130170617.000|20110130170620.000|TR0|
20110130170620.000|20110130170623.000|TR0|There is a -- there's no easy answer.  
20110130170623.000|20110130170626.000|TR0|And, clearly, increasing chaos or even 
20110130170626.000|20110130170628.000|TR0|violence in the streets, prison breaks, 
20110130170628.000|20110130170631.000|TR0|which we've had reports about, that is not 
20110130170631.000|20110130170634.000|TR0|the way to go.  We want to see this 
20110130170634.000|20110130170637.000|TR0|peaceful uprising on the part of the 
20110130170637.000|20110130170639.000|TR0|Egyptian people to demand their rights, to 
20110130170639.000|20110130170642.000|TR0|be responded to in a very clear, 
20110130170642.000|20110130170645.000|TR0|unambiguous way by the government and then 
20110130170645.000|20110130170648.000|TR0|a process of national dialogue that will 
20110130170648.000|20110130170651.000|TR0|lead to the changes that the Egyptian 
20110130170651.000|20110130170653.000|TR0|people seek and that they deserve.       
20110130170653.000|20110130170656.000|TR0|Now, that will take time.  It is unlikely 
20110130170656.000|20110130170659.000|TR0|to be done overnight without very grave 
20110130170659.000|20110130170702.000|TR0|consequences for everyone involved.  So 
20110130170702.000|20110130170704.000|TR0|what we want to see is, as we've said over 
20110130170704.000|20110130170707.000|TR0|and over again, the concrete steps taken.  
20110130170707.000|20110130170710.000|TR0|You know, it took 30 years to have a vice 
20110130170710.000|20110130170713.000|TR0|president appointed. We want to see both 
20110130170713.000|20110130170715.000|TR0|the existing and any new members of any 
20110130170715.000|20110130170718.000|TR0|government continue to put real life into

20110130170928.000|20110130170931.000|TR0|And we're not advocating -- we're not

20110130170934.000|20110130170937.000|TR0|advocating that the government, the

20110130170939.000|20110130170942.000|TR0|political opposition and activists begin a

20110130170945.000|20110130170948.000|TR0|
20110130170948.000|20110130170950.000|TR0|Egypt is a large, complex, very important 
20110130170950.000|20110130170953.000|TR0|country.  I don't think the Egyptian 
20110130170953.000|20110130170956.000|TR0|people want to see what is a very clear 
20110130170956.000|20110130170959.000|TR0|effort to obtain political and economic 
20110130170959.000|20110130171001.000|TR0|rights turn into any kind of new form of 
20110130171001.000|20110130171004.000|TR0|oppression or suppression or violence or 
20110130171004.000|20110130171007.000|TR0|letting loose criminal elements.  That's 
20110130171007.000|20110130171010.000|TR0|not what they're in the streets protesting 
20110130171010.000|20110130171013.000|TR0|for.
20110130171013.000|20110130171015.000|TR0|

20110130171018.000|20110130171021.000|TR0|to where they would like to be?  It needs

20110130171236.000|20110130171239.000|TR0|
20110130171239.000|20110130171242.000|TR0|OBAMA:  You must maintain your power 
20110130171242.000|20110130171245.000|TR0|through consent, not coercion.  You must 
20110130171245.000|20110130171248.000|TR0|respect the rights of minorities and 
20110130171248.000|20110130171250.000|TR0|participate with a spirit of tolerance and 
20110130171250.000|20110130171253.000|TR0|compromise.
20110130171253.000|20110130171256.000|TR0|
20110130171256.000|20110130171259.000|TR0|(END VIDEO CLIP)
20110130171259.000|20110130171301.000|TR0|
20110130171301.000|20110130171304.000|TR0|CROWLEY:  Yet, Mubarak, head of a secular 
20110130171304.000|20110130171307.000|TR0|government, has been a reliable ally, a 
20110130171307.000|20110130171310.000|TR0|conduit for the U.S. to other Arab 
20110130171310.000|20110130171312.000|TR0|nations.  He has maintained a cold peace 
20110130171312.000|20110130171315.000|TR0|with Israel, been helpful in the war on 
20110130171315.000|20110130171318.000|TR0|terror and opposed Iran's nuclear program. 
20110130171318.000|20110130171321.000|TR0| Cables recently part of the WikiLeaks

20110130172509.000|20110130172512.000|TR0|that it be constructive and that it be 
20110130172512.000|20110130172515.000|TR0|responsive to people's needs.  But it 
20110130172515.000|20110130172517.000|TR0|doesn't have to be tomorrow, it just has

20110130175004.000|20110130175006.000|TR0|economic and political freedoms.  It is 
20110130175006.000|20110130175009.000|TR0|not an anti-U.S. message primarily nor is 
20110130175009.000|20110130175012.000|TR0|it a fundamentalist, radical Islamist 
20110130175012.000|20110130175015.000|TR0|message but a secular message.  We want 
20110130175015.000|20110130175017.000|TR0|freedom.  We want economic and political 
20110130175017.000|20110130175020.000|TR0|freedom.  If the energy can be channeled 
20110130175020.000|20110130175023.000|TR0|constructively into free and open 
20110130175023.000|20110130175026.000|TR0|elections in September where there is some 
20110130175026.000|20110130175028.000|TR0|time for some secular opposition parties 
20110130175028.000|20110130175031.000|TR0|to germinate, that's probably the ideal 
20110130175031.000|20110130175034.000|TR0|outcome.  It's hardly a certainty, but 
20110130175034.000|20110130175037.000|TR0|it's certainly a real possibility.
20110130175037.000|20110130175040.000|TR0|

20110130175042.000|20110130175045.000|TR0|you that, when we first started this
